channel.title: Wasmtime and Wasi
channel.description:
[Wasmtime](https://github.com/CraneStation/wasmtime) is a web assembly runtime that runs WebAssembly code outside of the web. It supports the new spec, [WASI: WebAssembly System Interface](https://github.com/CraneStation/wasmtime/blob/master/docs/WASI-overview.md).
Is thing going to be like node.js and allow us to run the Rebol WASM servers with full I/O ?

item.title: Wasmtime and Wasi
item.dc:creator: gchiu
item.description:
A working party is moving towards a spec

Mozilla spake:

Today, we announce the start of a new standardization effort â€” WASI, the WebAssembly system interface.

And it seems that we should try to have some input into this. And wasn't Carl attempting to do this? Write for an abstracted interface, a machine that didn't exist. Which is what this appears to be what about.

Read full topic

item.title: Wasmtime and Wasi
item.dc:creator: Mark-hi
item.description:
Non sequitur. Both wasmtime and WASI are unstable prototypes, not "specs", and hence no useful conclusions can or should be reached about them, whether such involve Rebol or not.

Read full topic
